image.altText: Man speaking in front of microphones to a group of people

props.synopsis: Independent MP David O'Byrne has said he will support a no-confidence motion against treasurer Michael Ferguson when parliament resumes on Tuesday.

title.children: No confidence motion against embattled Tasmanian treasurer Michael Ferguson likely as David O'Byrne delivers decisive blow

image.altText: An artist's impression of a new ferry wharf

props.synopsis: A trial passenger service between Hobart and Bellerive has proven so successful that a permanent ferry terminal is being proposed.

title.children: Indoor waiting area, bicycle storage part of newly released designs for upgraded Bellerive ferry wharf

image.altText: Di standing in front of photos of Aboriginal lands rights activists.

props.synopsis: Di Spotswood, one of eight people elected last month to the Aboriginal Land Council of Tasmania, says it is a "continual fight" with the state government to negotiate land returns.Â

title.children: 'We need more of our land back': Eight First Nations people elected to manage Aboriginal-owned land in Tasmania

image.altText: Two men in glasses hold the pregnant tummy of a smiling woman sitting between them surrounded by flowers and greenery.

props.synopsis: Joel Reeve is eagerly awaiting the birth of his son after a stranger he met online agreed to be a surrogate. But he had to move his entire life to Tasmania to become a father.

title.children: Joel will soon be the first single man in Tasmania to have a child through surrogacy

image.altText: Cradle Mountain with Dove Lake in the foreground

props.synopsis: A 22-year old tourist has been assisted near Cradle Mountain, after attempting to climb the mountain sans footwear. It's prompted a reminder from police about the need to be properly prepared in the wilderness.

title.children: Hiker provided with assistance, and shoes, after attempting to climb Tasmanian mountain without them

image.altText: A woman in orange hi-vis workwear and hardhat aggressively points her finger at a middle-aged woman in a black t-shirt.

props.synopsis: A complaint made by two supporters of native forest logging who alleged they were discriminated against based on their political beliefs after being denied entry to a Bob Brown documentary sixteen months ago have had their case dismissed.

title.children: Pro-logging protesters tried to disrupt two film screenings in Tasmania. It ended in confrontation

image.altText: Derwent Valley youth collaboration 2024-08-27 10:08:00

props.synopsis: In this regional Tasmanian community, an 'us versus them' attitude has developed between its adults and young people. A new partnership between youth services is aimed at changing that and give their young people a voice.

title.children: Access to services in this regional community can be difficult. A new collaboration aims to change that

image.altText: A man standing in front of a "we will remember" sign, looking off camera.

props.synopsis: A planned vigil on the day before Remembrance Day at Hobart's Cenotaph has split local RSL groups in Tasmania, with one sub-branch saying the gathering is part of a "relentless single-minded attack" on the proposed stadium which is to be built nearby.

title.children: War of words breaks out over claims Hobart Cenotaph vigil is anti-stadium 'protest' in disguise

image.altText: A flag with black on the top, red on the bottom and a yellow circle in the middle held up high at a gathering of people.

props.synopsis: The Tasmanian government was due to introduce a bill earlier this year to amend the legislation governing the return of Aboriginal land. Instead, it's shelved it â and that's received a mixed reaction.

title.children: Did you miss? ð£ Tasmanian government shelves plans to amend law governing return of Aboriginal land

image.altText: A boy stands in a doorway while a police car with flashing lights is parked outside.

props.synopsis: Claire thought that she'd escaped domestic violence after leaving her abusive partner, but she then struggled to find help with the violent meltdowns from her trauma-affected son.

title.children: Claire's son had violent meltdowns so bad she called the police. Here's what she wished she knew then

image.altText: Siena Stubbs and Jim Hancock

props.synopsis: A year on from the Voice referendum, the country remains split about what the result means â and about the best path forward.

title.children: Australia voted no to a Voice to Parliament. Here's what might happen next

image.altText: Shot zoomed in on the top of the Bayswater coal-fired power plant, with its smoke stacks and high voltage power lines

props.synopsis: A remarkable first for coal power in Australia gave the beleaguered industry hope recently. But news this week might have snuffed it out again.

title.children: Can coal survive the solar spread? Major Australian power plant notches 'extraordinary' first

image.altText: A couple walks past a row of makeshift tens on the waterfront

props.synopsis: Beirut today is a tale of two cities â the areas being bombed by Israel and those where life carries on nearly like normal.

title.children: A fierce war is underway in southern Beirut. Twenty minutes away, people sip cocktails

image.altText: Australian visa in a passport

props.synopsis: Australia's had a particular immigration strategy for decades, but it's in major need of repair.

title.children: It's wrong to say Australia hasn't had an immigration strategy for decades â we're living with its consequences

image.altText: A man runs towards the camera carrying a blanket with stadium seating in teh background

props.synopsis: Gaza residents say Israeli forces have continued to pound Jabalia, the largest of its historic refugee camps in the north of the enclave, from the air and ground.Â

title.children: Israel fires at UN peacekeeping HQ for second day, 40 countries condemn attacks

image.altText: A woman stands in front of a map pinned to the wall behind her.

props.synopsis: Just weeks before the US election, polls suggest the race between Kamala Harris and Donald Trump remains a dead heat. In the key battleground state of Arizona, abortion might be a deciding factor.

title.children: Trump is in trouble with female voters. How his vow to be their 'protector' landed in a swing state

image.altText: Panguna mine in Bougainville

props.synopsis: A large-scale study of social and environmental impacts from Rio Tinto's abandoned Panguna mine in Bougainville finds a plethora of actual and potential human rights violations, including risks to life.

title.children: Landmark report uncovers human rights abuses at Rio Tinto gold mine in Bougainville

image.altText: A police car is parked on the tram tracks beside a McDonalds with Flinders St station in the background.

props.synopsis: Police are searching for a man after the 44-year-old victim was hit over the head in Elizabeth Street in Melbourne.

title.children: A man who was critically injured in an assault in busy CBD street dies in hospital

image.altText: A group people with a sign reading "white man fight back" near a stone cenotaph.

props.synopsis: Community leaders reject the "abhorrent" rally and reassure people Corowa is a safe multicultural community after a white supremacist rally in the centre of the border town.

title.children: Calls grow for NSW to ban Nazi salute, symbols after 'disgusting' rally in Corowa

image.altText: Senator James Paterson speaking in suit.

props.synopsis: The Coalition has outlined the conditions that would need to be met before it would support a ceasefire deal in the Middle East, acknowledging that its position is out of step with that of Australia's main ally, the United States.Â

title.children: Shadow home affairs minister says it is not 'remarkable' for his position on ceasefire in Gaza to differ to from Biden administration's

image.altText: Brodie Kostecki drives

props.synopsis: The marquee race of the Supercars season is here as Australia and New Zealand's best drivers tackle the famous Mount Panorama. Follow live.

title.children: Safety car finally deployed with 29 laps to go in Bathurst 1000 to set up grandstand finale

image.altText: Two men in glasses hold the pregnant tummy of a smiling woman sitting between them surrounded by flowers and greenery.

props.synopsis: Joel Reeve is eagerly awaiting the birth of his son after a stranger he met online agreed to be a surrogate. But he had to move his entire life to Tasmania to become a father.

title.children: Outdated surrogacy laws meant Joel had to fight for fatherhood. Now he's met Jess, it's a fight he's winning

image.altText: A grainy, dark picture of two young girls smiling, wearing warm caps.

props.synopsis: Libby German, 14, and her best friend Abigail Williams, 13, disappeared during a hike near their home town in Delphi, Indiana. Their killing would go on to garner international attention.Â

title.children: Libby German recorded her own killer. Now the man accused of murdering her and her best friend is on trial

image.altText: Headshot of Alex Salmond in suit touching his ear

props.synopsis: Alex Salmond, the former first minister of Scotland who for decades championed Scotland's independence from the UK and nearly accomplished it, dies aged 69.

title.children: Alex Salmond, former Scottish first minister, dies after reportedly collapsing while giving a speech

image.altText: A glamorous-looking Indonesian woman and Australian man smile and pose for a photo while holding drinks.

title.children: Influencer wife of ex-AFL player arrested in Bali raids targeting illegal prostitution

image.altText: A petrol station with huge flames and clouds of smoke around it.

props.synopsis: Two children were among the four killed in the blast after a fuel tank exploded in Chechnya's main city, Grozny.

title.children: Fiery explosion at Chechen petrol station kills four and injuries five

image.altText: Two large groups in camouflage military uniform, carrying red rifles with bayonets, yell and charge past each other in the bush.

props.synopsis: The Defence Department has outlined a new "careers referral" initiative that sets up "an incentive scheme to encourage members to refer people to join the ADF".

title.children: Australian soldiers to be offered $1,000 cash bonuses if they recruit someone else into the military

image.altText: A silver car with dinted side panels and a broken mirror in a carpark behind police tape at night.

props.synopsis: Police witnessed three people being struck when they responded to a party in a Kooyong park.

title.children: One pedestrian dead and another injured after being hit by car at party

image.altText: Older woman with blond hair and glasses in British police uniform

props.synopsis: Many observers of the criminal justice system say screening for ADHD could help alleged offenders break destructive cycles of behaviour. Is it time to introduce it across Australia?

title.children: In London, police screen alleged offenders for ADHD â should Australia do the same?

image.altText: A man in bun pictured from behind.

props.synopsis: Working holiday visas in Australia are plugged on social media as an easy money grab while travelling, but behind the glitz and glamour are some horror stories.

title.children: 'How are we going to escape?': Indonesian working holiday-makers say they were 'scammed'

image.altText: a woman next to a sign

props.synopsis: Youth crime rates have plummeted in Queensland despite claims from both major parties that the state is in the grip of a crisis.

title.children: Australia's youth crime rates have plummeted despite what politicians would have you believe

image.altText: Brisbane Broncos' Adam Reynolds gestures to the crowd during an NRL match.

props.synopsis: At the start of next month, a new season begins in the NRL as players entering the final year of their contracts can start talking to other clubs. Here are 10 of the biggest talking points ahead of November 1.

title.children: Ten burning issues as NRL free agents prepare to go to market

image.altText: Wallaroos players Layne Morgan and Desiree Miller lie on the field with the WXV trophy after beating Scotland.

props.synopsis: The Wallaroos officially book their spot at the Women's Rugby World Cup with a thrilling victory over an ill-disciplined Scotland side.

title.children: Wallaroos win first major trophy and lock in Rugby World Cup spot

image.altText: Millie Elliott shows offer her premiership ring while posing with her family after the Sydney Roosters won the NRLW grand final.

title.children: Sydney Roosters star Millie Elliott's NRLW premiership ring stolen

image.altText: A man smiling at a camera for a headshot with his arms crossed

props.synopsis: Small actions, especially early on, can make a meaningful difference to your final superannuation amount.

title.children: Daniel has salary sacrificed for 20 years. His superannuation balance is more than $50,000 better off
